control

Class Tools

  • java.lang.Object
    • control.Tools

  • public class Tools
extends java.lang.Object
    The Tools class is where most of the code is executed. Here is where, with the parameters received from the Main class, every single possibility is tested and eventually returned.
    Author:
    Tòfol Martínez

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private static int counter
      An integer that counts the amount of possible paths by the snake.
      private static java.lang.String[] directions
      An array containing all four possible directions in String form.
      private static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> movements
      An empty ArrayList that will be filled and used to test every possible movement by the snake.

      Since the "contains" method doesn't work on arrays (because it doesn't compare the contents, just the raw data of it), this method will take care of comparing each value in the snake to the next available position.

    • Method Detail

      • numberOfAvailableDifferentPaths

        public static int numberOfAvailableDifferentPaths(int[] board,
                                                  int[][] snake,
                                                  int depth)
        The main method of the Tools class, it simply calls on the other methods in order to make the application work. First, it calls generateMovements to create the String ArrayList with every possible movement and then it uses checkIfMovePossible on every movement iteration. To do that, since the exercise asks for every movement to happen simultaneously, we create a Runnable that will use said method, and then run it on individual threads. Finally, we join the threads so that they don't overstep each other and making them wait until each and every one of them has finished working. If we don't, we will get a different result each time, depending on the processor speed.
        Parameters:
        board - The board where the snake will be moving around, on a int[x,y] format. It's passed on by the Main class.
        snake - The snake on a 2D int array format. It's passed on by the Main class.
        depth - An integer that determines the depth of movement, also passed on by the Main class.
        Returns:
        The method returns the move counter on integer form.

      • generateMovements

        private static void generateMovements(java.lang.String loop,
                                      int depth)
        A simple recursive method to add every possible movement iteration to the ArrayList, only using the directions array as well as the movement depth. While recursiveness is still not optimal in most cases, it works as intended here, even with really large depths, and it certainly works better than the original solution.
        Parameters:
        loop - A (initially empty) string that keeps on filling itself and being added to the ArrayList.
        depth - The depth of movement. The method will loop as long as there are still movement possibilities to be added.

      • checkIfMovePossible

        private static void checkIfMovePossible(java.lang.String move,
                                        int[] board,
                                        int[][] snake)
        This method is used to check every possible movement that could be done by the snake. By receiving a movement parameter (UDL, RRU, etc.), the board and the snake itself, we test every possible step, move the snake alongside it, and finally, if everything can be completed correctly, add a point to the final counter.
        Parameters:
        move - A string containing the movements to be checked.
        board - The board where the snake will be moving around, on a int[x,y] format.
        snake - The snake on a 2D int array format.

      • steppingOnTop

        private static boolean steppingOnTop(int[] snakeHead,
                                     int[][] snake)
        Since the "contains" method doesn't work on arrays (because it doesn't compare the contents, just the raw data of it), this method will take care of comparing each value in the snake to the next available position.
        Parameters:
        snakeHead - The position where the snake head will supposedly move to next.
        snake - The array containing the snake in full.
        Returns:
        found, a boolean that tells us if the position we're moving to is already being used.
